title: Binomial series
summary:
In mathematics, the binomial series is the Taylor series for the function 
  
    
      
        f
      
    
    {\displaystyle f}
  
 given by 
  
    
      
        f
        (
        x
        )
        =
        (
        1
        +
        x
        
          )
          
            α
          
        
        ,
      
    
    {\displaystyle f(x)=(1+x)^{\alpha },}
  
 where 
  
    
      
        α
        ∈
        
          C
        
      
    
    {\displaystyle \alpha \in \mathbb {C} }
  
 is an arbitrary complex number and |x| < 1. Explicitly,
